alert.note: Alert for Clark; Pike (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 11:52AM CDT until August 21 at 2:55PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Clark County in southwestern Arkansas... Southern Pike County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until 255 PM CDT. * At 1152 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Murfreesboro, Gurdon, Okolona, Whelen Springs, Beirne, Richwoods, Crater Of Diamonds State Park, Delight, Antoine, Billstown, Burtsell, Curtis, Pisgah, Vaden, Roy and Highland in Pike County. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
